name: debugger-for-chrome
description: Debug your JavaScript code in the Chrome browser, or any other target that supports the Chrome Debugger protocol.

initialConfigurations.name: Launch Chrome against localhost, with sourcemaps

port.description: Port to use for Chrome remote debugging.

file.description: A local html file to open in the browser

url.description: A url to open in the browser

webRoot.description: When the 'url' field is specified, this specifies the workspace absolute path to the webserver root.

runtimeExecutable.description: Workspace absolute path to the runtime executable to be used. If not specified, Chrome will be used from the default install location.

runtimeArgs.description: Optional arguments passed to the runtime executable.

sourceMaps.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).

diagnosticLogging.description: When true, the adapter logs its own diagnostic info to the console in a human readable format

verboseDiagnosticLogging.description: When true, the adapter logs all traffic with the client and target (as well as the info logged by 'diagnosticLogging')

userDataDir.description: When set, Chrome is launched with the --user-data-dir option set to this path

sourceMapPathOverrides.description: A set of mappings for rewriting the locations of source files from what the sourcemap says, to their locations on disk. See README for details.

smartStep.description: Automatically step through generated code that cannot be mapped back to the original source.

skipFiles.description: An array of file or folder names, or path globs, to skip when debugging.
